segments.text: I notice the boy balancing on that wobbly stool, and it makes me nervous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s stretching so far to reach the cookie jar, and the stool is already tilting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think he’s going to fall any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie, like nothing bad could ever happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe the woman hasn’t turned around yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the sink, and she’s still drying that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like this is one of those moments where everything goes wrong at once.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy’s plate is shaking in his hand, and I can see him losing balance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the girl even realizes how dangerous this is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just a mess, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think I’d be screaming if I were in that kitchen right now.
segments.speaker: PAR
